meanings.definition: To lean or lie back in a relaxed position.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, she reclined on the sofa to rest.
meanings.sent2: He reclined on the beach chair, enjoying the warm sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat reclined lazily on the windowsill, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the mountains reclined into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The old man reclined in his favorite armchair, reminiscing about his youth.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she reclined on the hammock all afternoon.
meanings.sent2: He reclined on the bed after finishing his work.
meanings.sent3: The dog happily reclined on the grass after a long walk.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden reclined gracefully in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The tired traveler reclined in the comfortable train seat, grateful for the journey's end.
